item.description:
﻿

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Buongiorno,

Well the week of our Festa di Natale is upon us!!! 37 to date!!! We may have to seal the doors at this point.  

Here's an update from our host. To date, only 1/3 of those that RSVPd "YES" have emailed Janet about what they are bringing. 

Please, please email Janet with what you will bringing to the party. It is imperative to have some sort of control as to the menu for a party of this size. Also remember to make sure the dish or whatever you bring to eat will serve 10-12 people. Don't forget a bottle of San Pellegirno/Italian soda or whatever you would like to drink.

If the email is not being shown here at the bottom of this write up, Janet is listed as a co-organizer on the upper left of our main page. Click on her name and send her an email. Grazie! 

As of today, November 29 we need to have antipasti and contorni as we have very few that are bringing these 2 menu items.

 

****** Update for Friday, November 18 *************

From our hostess and menu committee: Since we are such a large group now at the party, which I love, so it's not a problem, everyone should bring a dish to share that would serve 10 people more or less at minimum and something they like to drink.

What you can bring as far as food along with a beverage (vino, San Pellegrino...etc.)

  • Antipasti: Italian cured meats (Prosciutto, soppresatto....etc)
  • Contorni (side dishes): broccoli rabe w/o sausage, insalata, stuffed mushrooms, etc.
  • Primi Piatti (main dishes): Franco one of our chefs will be making 3 types of pasta dishes, fresh. So you need not worry about pasta. Some ideas, Porchetta, baked pasta dish is fine, Chicken Marsala, eggplant parm,,, whatever you can muster up will be fine.
  • Dolci (Desserts): pies, cakes, cookies, canolis - you get the drift :). There will be plenty of espresso, decaf coffee and tea.

If you haven't the time to cook or if it's not your forte, consider bringing the one or two of the following:

  • bottles of wine, San Pellegrino, nuts, chocolate, cheese wedges (may I suggest Grana Padano), crackers to go along with the cheese. Foccacio bread, suffed breads. etc. Limoncello would be nice to finish off our gastronomical affair.

If anyone has Christmas music they would like to share that evening, bring it along.

Please, please email Janet and let her know what you are bringing so that she can coordinate the menu of sort for the evening. Her email address is janetcandela@sbcglobal.net  

 

 

Clear your calendars! If you've never made one of our meetups, this one is perfect! Relaxed, festive and joyful!  

Her address will be made public only to those who RSVP "YES", days before the actual event.

Ci vediamo!

Lorenzo
item.name: 4th Annual Festa di Natale - West Hartford, CT
